title: An integrative analysis combining bioinformatics, network pharmacology and experimental methods identified key genes of EGCG targets in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma.
abstract: Epigallocatechin gallate (EGCG), a frequently studied catechin in green tea, has been shown to be involved in the antiproliferation and apoptosis of human Nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) cells. However, the pharmacological targets and mechanism by which EGCG can combat NPC patients remain to be studied in detail.
